resources.string: Is it OK to apply gpx data points to the photo album?
GPSClipper lets you select a local file of GeoRss type data, using Lat/Long data to update a Web based photo album in a batch process.
Start the app and Log in to Gmail if necessary then, click on the button in the Google page. This allows the app access to your albums on Picasa.
Select the album in the Albums Select screen. This album photos will be updated with GeoRss data Latitude and Longitude.
Select the app you normally use to choose files on the phone. File Manager and Astro are 2 popular apps for this purpose.
Select the folder and the file containing the GeoRss data that covers the same period of time during which the album photos were taken.
Review the selections for the Album to be updated and the GeoRss data file that will be the source of the Latitude Longitude used to update the photos in the album.
Click on OK and wait while the phone controls updates on the web photos. Message alert will display on phone when updates are completed.
